docs.title: Welcome to nBlick Documentation
docs.text:
Welcome to the official documentation for nBlick — the AI Brand Visibility platform built for the LLM era.

As search shifts from Google to AI assistants like ChatGPT, Gemini, Perplexity, Claude, Mistral, DeepSeek, and others, brands face a new question:

How is my brand being represented inside AI-generated answers?

nBlick gives you that visibility.

docs.title: Why nBlick Exists
docs.text:
Large Language Models are becoming the new discovery layer of the internet. Customers now ask AI:

  • "What's the best tool for X?"
  • "Which company should I choose for Y?"
  • "Compare Brand A vs Brand B"
  • "What are alternatives to Z?"

If your brand isn't mentioned — or is mentioned incorrectly — you're invisible.

nBlick helps brands and companies:

  • Track how often they are mentioned across every major LLM
  • Understand how they are described
  • Monitor competitor presence
  • Detect positioning gaps
  • Measure AI visibility over time

We do for AI answers what SEO tools did for search engines.

docs.title: What nBlick Tracks
docs.text:
nBlick continuously monitors and analyzes responses across:

  • ChatGPT
  • Gemini
  • Perplexity
  • Claude
  • Mistral
  • DeepSeek
  • And emerging LLM platforms

Every day, we generate queries, collect responses, and transform them into structured, actionable insights.

docs.title: Daily Metrics & AI Visibility Analysis
docs.text:
nBlick runs automated analysis pipelines daily to compute:

  • Brand Mention Rate — How often your brand appears
  • Share of AI Voice — Visibility vs competitors
  • Sentiment & Positioning Signals
  • Category Association Trends
  • Ranking Presence in AI Recommendations

This allows you to:

  • Track progress over time
  • Measure the impact of marketing or PR campaigns
  • Identify new growth opportunities
  • Detect sudden drops or competitor surges

docs.title: Built for the AI Discovery Era
docs.text:
Traditional analytics tools weren't designed for generative AI. nBlick is.

We help marketing, brand, and growth teams answer:

  • Are we visible inside AI?
  • Are we recommended?
  • Are competitors outranking us?
  • Is our positioning consistent?

AI is now a distribution channel. nBlick helps you measure and optimize it.

docs.title: How to Use This Documentation
docs.text:
This documentation will guide you through:

  • Core concepts behind AI visibility tracking
  • How nBlick structures metrics and analysis
  • How to interpret your dashboard
  • Best practices for improving LLM presence

Welcome to the AI visibility layer. Let's measure what AI says about you.

docs.title: Metrics Overview
docs.text: Get a clear view of the key metrics that guide your AI visibility strategy. nBlick helps brands understand how they are seen and mentioned by LLMs across the AI landscape.

docs.title: The Three Pillars of AI Visibility
docs.text: nBlick tracks three fundamental dimensions of your brand's presence inside AI responses:

docs.title: Brand Sentiment Analysis
docs.text:
The overall perception of your brand as reflected by AI.

The sentiment score reflects the overall brand perception. A score of 0% indicates a generally negative perception, while a score of 100% represents an excellent perception.

docs.title: Share of Voice
docs.text:
The ratios of mentions of your brand and its products on common queries to the LLM.

Share of Voice measures how often your brand is mentioned relative to competitors across AI-generated responses. Toggle between product-specific and aggregated brand views to understand your presence at different levels.

docs.title: Brand Keywords
docs.text:
The top 10 most frequently associated words, phrases, and topics linked to your brand.

These keywords represent recurring themes that LLMs commonly connect with your brand, focusing on both positive and negative associations that reflect the brand's values and customer perception.

docs.title: How nBlick Metrics Are Generated
docs.text:
Continuous Data Collection

nBlick runs queries across all tracked LLMs daily. Since AI responses can vary, we aggregate and analyze data over time to generate meaningful metrics.

Metrics come from multiple sources:

  • AI Responses — Individual answers to brand-related prompts
  • Referenced Sources — Articles, websites, and documents that AI cites
  • Trend Analysis — Patterns observed across configurable time periods

docs.title: Interpreting Your Metrics
docs.text: Metric Positive Signal Warning Sign Brand Sentiment Analysis High sentiment score (closer to 100%) Declining score or persistently low percentage Share of Voice Steady or growing mention ratios Decreasing visibility or competitor growth Brand Keywords Positive, relevant keyword associations Negative or off-brand keyword trends

docs.title: Cross-LLM Insights
docs.text:
Different AI models may present your brand differently — this is normal, as each LLM has unique training data and response behavior.

Compare Across Models

Compare across models to discover where your brand is strongest and identify opportunities for improvement.
